  proposition: Amita Kamath, Jack Hessel, and Kai-Wei Chang published a paper about text encoders bottlenecking compositionality in contrastive vision-language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Amita Kamath|PUBLISHED|Research Paper
    Jack Hessel|PUBLISHED|Research Paper
    Kai-Wei Chang|PUBLISHED|Research Paper
    Text Encoders|BOTTLENECK|Compositionality

    Amita Kamath|CO_AUTHORED|Kai-Wei Chang

    Text Encoders|IMPACT|Vision-Language Models

  proposition: Zhiqiu Lin, Xinyue Chen, Deepak Pathak, Pengchuan Zhang, and Deva Ramanan investigated the role of language priors in vision-language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhiqiu Lin|INVESTIGATED|Language Priors

  proposition: Zixian Ma, Jerry Hong, Mustafa Omer Gul, Mona Gandhi, Irena Gao, and Ranjay Krishna explored compositional reasoning in vision-language foundation models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zixian Ma|EXPLORED|Compositional Reasoning

  proposition: Mert Yuksekgonul, Federico Bianchi, Pratyusha Kalluri, Dan Jurafsky, and James Y. Zou studied why vision-language models behave like bags-of-words.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Vision-Language Models|BEHAVIOR|Bags-of-Words

  proposition: Tan Wang, Kevin Lin, Linjie Li, Chung-Ching Lin, Zhengyuan Yang, Hanwang Zhang, Zicheng Liu, and Lijuan Wang proposed equivariant similarity for vision-language foundation models.
    entity-attribute relationships:

  proposition: Zhiqiu Lin, Deepak Pathak, Baiqi Li, Jiayao Li, Xide Xia, Graham Neubig, Pengchuan Zhang, and Deva Ramanan evaluated text-to-visual generation using image-to-text generation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhiqiu Lin|EVALUATED|Text-to-Visual Generation

  proposition: Ziqi Gao, Weikai Huang, Jieyu Zhang, Aniruddha Kembhavi, and Ranjay Krishna proposed scene graph programming for evaluating and improving text-to-vision generation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ziqi Gao|PROPOSED|Scene Graph Programming

    Ziqi Gao|CO_AUTHORED|Ranjay Krishna
    Scene Graph Programming|APPLIED_TO|Text-to-Vision Generation

  proposition: Multiple researchers have explored safety and security in text-to-image generation, including works on:
Erasing concepts from diffusion models
Developing safety frameworks for text-to-image generation
Automatic red-teaming for text-to-image models
Suppressing sexual content generation
Investigating backdoor attacks on diffusion models
Eliminating backdoors in diffusion models
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Text-to-Image Generation|FOCUS|Safety
    Text-to-Image Generation|FOCUS|Security
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Diffusion Models|SUBJECT_OF|Concept Erasure
    Diffusion Models|SUBJECT_OF|Backdoor Attacks
    Diffusion Models|SUBJECT_OF|Backdoor Elimination
